meanings.definition: To compel or force someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher constrains the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The law constrains citizens to follow certain rules for safety.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy constrains its owner to play fetch by bringing the ball repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The storm constrains the river to overflow its banks, causing flooding in the area.
meanings.sent5: The strict schedule constrains me to finish my work efficiently.

meanings.definition: To restrict or limit someone or something
meanings.sent1: Financial constraints constrain our ability to travel to exotic destinations.
meanings.sent2: Time constraints often constrain our ability to complete tasks within a set timeframe.
meanings.sent3: The old bridge constrains the flow of traffic due to its narrow lanes.
meanings.sent4: Fear can constrain our minds, preventing us from exploring new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The small budget constrains our options for upgrading our equipment.
